page.title: 02Notable Ticehurst Families
page.content: There are several families in Ticehurst whose names go back for many centuries and are still remembered either because of descendants or place names. Some appear in the church like Sir William D'Ethyngham who gave money to build Ticehurst Church. His coat of arms is in the porch, azure, fretty argent.The Courthopes' who go back 400 years, is argent, a fesse azure between 3 estoiles of six wavy sable. The Newingtons are another major family, the first being Sir Adam born in 1481. Dr.Charles Newington founded Ticehurst House, a sanatorium which is open today. The family live at Oakover but the name is now Dreuce. The Noakes family, now Reeves, live and farm at Overys. Pashley farm gets its name from a Norman knight Robert De Passele. The name Wybarne goes back to John Wybarne who died in 1490.
